__TOC__

== Video Overview ==

This video shows how photos taken on a digital camera can be copied to the computers hard disk and then shows a couple of applications that can be used to manage the pictures.

== Target Audience ==

* Users

== Pre-requisites ==

Are there any other tutorial videos that people might benefit from having already seen?

== Required Knowledge ==

Specific things they really should already know.

== Recommended Knowledge ==

Other stuff that might be useful for them to know but isn't essential.

== Objectives ==

* Get photos off a camera or memory card
* Determine where the photos are stored
* Manage the photos

== Draft Step-by-Step Plan ==

# Connect digital camera
# Click import
# Point out that we want to import the photos with f-spot and not gThumb
# Change the defaults so that photos are imported with f-spot
# Re-connect camera
# Import
# Show them that their photos are imported
# Create a new tag
# Tag some photos
# Remove a tag
# Demonstrate finding images by their tags
# Demonstrate the timeline at the top
# Close f-spot
# Show them that their photos are in ~/Photos
# Conclude
